00055 # Load Resource
00056 import common_rc
00057 # When using loadUiType(), the generated (and executed) code will try to import
00058 # common_rc and it will crash if we don't ensure it's available in PYTHONPATH
00059 # so by no we have to add Koo/Common to sys.path
00060 sys.path.append( os.path.abspath(os.path.dirname(__file__)) )

00062 ## @brief Returns a dictionary with all the attributes found in a XML with their 
00063 # name as key and the corresponding value.
00064 def nodeAttributes(node):
00065    result = {}
00066    attrs = node.attributes
00067    if attrs is None:
00068         return {}
00069    for i in range(attrs.length):
00070         result[attrs.item(i).localName] = attrs.item(i).nodeValue
00071    return result

00073 (SelectionDialogUi, SelectionDialogBase) = loadUiType( uiPath('win_selection.ui') )
00074 
00075 ## @brief The SelectionDialog class shows a dialog prompting the user to choose
00076 # among a list of items.
00077 #
00078 # The selected value is stored in the 'result' property.
00079 # @see selection()
00080 class SelectionDialog(QDialog, SelectionDialogUi):      
00081         def __init__(self, title, values, parent=None):
00082                 QDialog.__init__(self, parent)
00083                 SelectionDialogUi.__init__(self)
00084                 self.setupUi( self )
00085 
00086                 if title:
00087                         self.uiTitle.setText( title )
00088                 for x in values.keys():
00089                         item = QListWidgetItem()
00090                         item.setText(x)
00091                         item.value = values[x]
00092                         self.uiList.addItem( item )
00093                 self.connect( self.pushAccept, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.selected )
00094 
00095         def selected(self):
00096                 self.result = ""
00097                 item = self.uiList.currentItem()
00098                 self.result = ( unicode(item.text()), item.value )
00099                 self.accept()
00100 
00101 ## @brief Shows the SelectionDialog
00102 #
00103 # It returns the selected item or False if none was selected.
00104 #
00105 # No dialog will be shown if the dictionary of values is empty. If alwaysask 
00106 # is False (the default) no dialog is shown and the only element is returned
00107 # as selected.
00108 def selection(title, values, alwaysask=False):
00109         if len(values) == 0:
00110                 return None
00111         elif len(values)==1 and (not alwaysask):
00112                 key = values.keys()[0]
00113                 return (key, values[key])
00114         s = SelectionDialog(title, values)
00115         if s.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted:
00116                 return s.result
00117         else:
00118                 return False
00119

00121 (TipOfTheDayDialogUi, TipOfTheDayDialogBase) = loadUiType( uiPath('tip.ui') )

00123 ## @brief The TipOfTheDayDialog class shows a dialog with a Tip of the day
00124 # TODO: Use KTipDialog when we start using KDE libs
00125 class TipOfTheDayDialog( QDialog, TipOfTheDayDialogUi ):
00126         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00127                 QDialog.__init__(self, parent)
00128                 TipOfTheDayDialogUi.__init__(self)
00129                 self.setupUi( self )
00130 
00131                 try:
00132                         self.number = int(Options.options['tip.position'])
00133                 except:
00134                         self.number = 0
00135         
00136                 self.connect( self.pushNext, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.nextTip )
00137                 self.connect( self.pushPrevious, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.previousTip )
00138                 self.connect( self.pushClose, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.closeTip )
00139                 self.uiShowNextTime.setChecked( Options.options['tip.autostart'] )
00140                 self.showTip()
00141         
00142         def showTip(self):
00143                 tips = file(searchFile('kootips.txt')).read().split('---')
00144                 tip = tips[self.number % len(tips)]
00145                 del tips
00146                 self.uiTip.setText(tip)
00147 
00148         def nextTip(self):
00149                 self.number+=1
00150                 self.showTip()
00151 
00152         def previousTip(self):
00153                 if self.number>0:
00154                         self.number -= 1
00155                 self.showTip()
00156 
00157         def closeTip(self):
00158                 Options.options['tip.autostart'] = self.uiShowNextTime.isChecked()
00159                 Options.options['tip.position'] = self.number+1
00160                 Options.options.save()
00161                 self.close()

00163 ## @brief Shows a warning dialog. Function used by the notifier in the Koo application.
00164 def warning(title, message):
00165         QApplication.setOverrideCursor( Qt.ArrowCursor )
00166         QMessageBox.warning(None, title, message)
00167         QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()
00168 
00169 ## @brief The ConcurrencyErrorDialog class provices a Dialog used when a 
00170 # concurrency error is received from the server.
00171 class ConcurrencyErrorDialog(QMessageBox):
00172         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00173                 QMessageBox.__init__(self, parent)      
00174                 self.setIcon( QMessageBox.Warning )
00175                 self.setWindowTitle( _('Concurrency warning') )
00176                 self.setText( _('<b>Write concurrency warning:</b><br/>This document has been modified while you were editing it.') )
00177                 self.addButton( _('Save anyway'), QMessageBox.AcceptRole )
00178                 self.addButton( _('Compare'), QMessageBox.ActionRole )
00179                 self.addButton( _('Do not save'), QMessageBox.RejectRole )
00180         
00181 ## @brief Shows the ConcurrencyErrorDialog. Function used by the notifier in the Koo application.
00182 def concurrencyError(model, id, context):
00183         QApplication.setOverrideCursor( Qt.ArrowCursor )
00184         dialog = ConcurrencyErrorDialog()
00185         result = dialog.exec_()
00186         QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()
00187         if result == 0:
00188                 return True
00189         if result == 1:
00190                 Api.instance.createWindow( False, model, id, context=context )
00191 
00192         return False

00194 (ErrorDialogUi, ErrorDialogBase) = loadUiType( uiPath('error.ui') )
00195 
00196 ## @brief The ErrorDialog class shows the error dialog used everywhere in Koo.
00197 #
00198 # The dialog shows two tabs. One with a short description of the problem and the
00199 # second one with the details, usually a backtrace.
00200 #
00201 # @see error()
00202 class ErrorDialog( QDialog, ErrorDialogUi ):
00203         def __init__(self, title, message, details='', parent=None):
00204                 QDialog.__init__(self, parent)
00205                 ErrorDialogUi.__init__(self)
00206                 self.setupUi( self )
00207 
00208                 self.uiDetails.setText( details )
00209                 self.uiErrorInfo.setText( message )
00210                 self.uiErrorTitle.setText( title )
00211                 QApplication.changeOverrideCursor( Qt.ArrowCursor )
00212         
00213         def done(self, r):
00214                 QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()
00215                 QDialog.done(self, r)
00216 
00217 
00218 ## @brief Shows the ErrorDialog. Function used by the notifier in the Koo application.
00219 def error(title, message, details=''):
00220         log = logging.getLogger('common.message')
00221         log.error('MSG %s: %s' % (unicode(message),details))
00222         dialog = ErrorDialog( unicode(title), unicode(message), unicode(details) )
00223         dialog.exec_()

00225 (ProgressDialogUi, ProgressDialogBase) = loadUiType( uiPath('progress.ui') )
00226                 
00227 ## @brief The ProgressDialog class shows a progress bar moving left and right until you stop it.
00228 #
00229 # To use it:
00230 # 1) Create a dialog (eg. dlg = ProgressDialog(self))
00231 # 2) Call the start function (eg. dlg.start() )
00232 # 3) Call the stop function when the operation has finished (eg. dlg.stop() )
00233 # Take into account that the dialog will only show after a couple of seconds. This way, it
00234 # only appears on long running tasks.
00235 class ProgressDialog(QDialog, ProgressDialogUi):
00236         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00237                 QDialog.__init__(self, parent)
00238                 ProgressDialogUi.__init__(self)
00239                 self.setupUi( self )
00240                 self.progressBar.setMinimum( 0 )
00241                 self.progressBar.setMaximum( 0 )
00242                 
00243         def start(self):
00244                 self.timer = QTimer()
00245                 self.connect( self.timer, SIGNAL('timeout()'), self.timeout )
00246                 self.timer.start( 2000 )
00247 
00248         def timeout(self):
00249                 self.timer.stop()
00250                 self.show()
00251                 
00252         def stop(self):
00253                 self.timer.stop()
00254                 self.accept()
00255 
00256 ## @brief Opens the given file with system's default application.
00257 def openFile( fileName ):
00258         if os.name == 'nt':
00259                 os.startfile(fileName)
00260         elif os.uname()[0] == 'Darwin':
00261                 os.system('/usr/bin/open -a Preview %s' % fileName)
00262         else:
00263                 os.spawnlp(os.P_NOWAIT, 'xdg-open', 'xdg-open', fileName)
00264 
00265 ## @brief Converts GTK accelerators to Qt ones.
00266 # GTK uses underscore as accelerator in labels and buttons whereas Qt uses
00267 # ampersand. This function will convert a text prepared for a GTK label into
00268 # a valid Qt one.
00269 def normalizeLabel( text ):
00270         res = ''
00271         underscore = False
00272         for x in text:
00273                 if x == '_':
00274                         if underscore:
00275                                 res += '_'
00276                                 underscore = False
00277                         else:
00278                                 underscore = True
00279                 else:
00280                         if underscore:
00281                                 res += '&'
00282                                 underscore = False
00283                         if x == '&':
00284                                 res += '&&'
00285                         else:
00286                                 res += x
00287         return res
